list.name: Changes
list.comment: Fixed the previously mentioned bug. The bug had caused random Enemies to move at significantly slower speeds when spawned than they are supposed to. In addition to fixing that bug, the GameScene class has also been set up to now fit any computer screen. Lastly, in addition to fixing the previously mentioned animation bug, all other animation bugs have been fixed. These bugs include: Enemies getting stuck at spawn, Enemies stopping at various Positions along their set Path, and Enemies moving at slightly different speeds.

task.summary: Default task

Added the GreaterThan and LessThan annotations. These annotations serve as a way to make a sure a Number value given to a method is either greater than or less than a specified value. In addition to the annotations, two classes, the GreaterThanAnnotation and LessThanAnnotation classes, were added as a way to verify if the number is a valid input to a method.

Added a new "exceptions" package. This package contains various classes that, as of right now, extend the RuntimeException class. All the current exceptions that have been made are meant to be thrown when any of the custom-built annotations' contracts are violated. For example, if a method annotated with the Specific annotation is called by an unspecified calling class, then an UnspecifiedAccessException will be thrown.

Files have now been organized in a slightly different way. Anything that will be added to a scene during game runtime has now been placed in its own package. Certain packages like the enemies and towers packages were placed into the elements package. Anything meant to assist in game development such as annotations and exceptions were placed into the tools package. Both of these package can be found in the main package.

Added static imports to certain classes. Going forwards, anything directly related to game management such as lists containing active enemies and towers should simply be imported using static imports. If the constant does not meet these criteria, then static imports should not be used and the constant should simply be referenced using its parent class.

Certain classes now implement the Serializable interface and have their own serial version UIDs. These classes include each of the custom-made exceptions as well as the Enemy class and its subclasses. A static global logger has also been implemented for use. It should only be used to describe the actions of any class annotated with the GameElement annotation. Building off of that, any static constants or methods in the new com.averagegames.ultimatetowerdefense.game package should be statically imported. Enabling and disabling subclass specification for the Specific and Prohibited annotations has also implemented. Lastly, the Builder interface has been added. This interface provides various methods that allow any class implementing it to build custom Scenes that can be added to a Stage.

Updated the GameElement annotation so that only certain strings can be provided as a parameter. These strings must be equal to either "character", "component", or "graphic". Characters are any moving features of the game. For example, an Enemy would be a character. Components are features on a map that do some sort of action. For example, a Spawner spawns enemies. Graphics are any features that are for purely design.

Updated the GameElement annotation so that only certain strings can be provided as a parameter. These strings must be equal to either "character", "component", or "graphic". Characters are any moving features of the game. For example, an Enemy would be a character. Components are features on a map that do some sort of action. For example, a Spawner spawns enemies. Graphics are any features that are for purely design.

Fixed several issues regarding the TranslationHandler class. It is now possible for the node and the destination to be provided as null. In addition to this, the duration can no longer be calculated if the speed is equal to 0. The animation's speed can also no longer be less than 0 because of the GreaterThan annotation.

Changed various features of the program. Logging is now disabled by default and must be manually activated using the "enableLogging" method in the Manager class. In addition to this, a new method was added to the Enemy class. This method is an overloaded version of the Enemy class' "spawn" method. The new method takes a Group to add the Enemy to as a parameter.

Added a static HashMap in the Builder interface. This HashMap can be used to easily manage custom-built Scenes. When Scenes are added to the HashMap, they should be paired with a unique ID, this way they can be easily found and identified. It is not a requirement for Scenes to be added to this HashMap, but it is heavily recommended.

Added the StrictHashMap class. This class functions almost identically to a HashMap but there is one key difference. The StrictHashMap does not allow for any identical keys or values to passed in. If the StrictHashMap already contains, for example, the key "1", no other pairs may use that key. The same rule applies to the values. If there is a value, for example, "Value", no other pairs may use that value. The SCENE_MANAGER constant in the Builder interface will use the StrictHashMap going forwards.
This commit is merely a test. The project faced several errors and a complete reset was necessary. Basically the project needed to be deleted and re-cloned from GitHub.

Added a "native" folder to the project. This is where all native C\C++ code will be located. Currently, there is only one C++ source file in this folder. This source file contains the native code for the "getTarget" method in the Enemy class.

Updated the project's structure. The header file for the native C++ code is now located within the native folder. It was previously located in the target folder which is ignored by the .gitignore file.

Added numerous classes to the project. These classes include the "Enemy" class, "Tower Class", and a whole variety of other classes. Each new file was previously used in an old Ultimate Tower Defense project and will now be used here. The structure of the folders and packages has been updated and cleaned up. Other features deemed to be useless or ineffective will also be removed in the future.

Made a few additional changes to the structure of the various packages within the project. The GreaterThan and LessThan annotations along with their respective exceptions and verifiers have been removed. More classes will likely be cleaned up or removed in the future.

Made a few more changes to the structure of the project. Several maven dependencies were removed as they were not actually doing anything useful. The rest of the custom annotation interfaces were also removed as they to were doing nothing. These should be the last of the changes made for the sole purpose of cleaning up the project.

Removed a few additional classes that were deemed inherently useless. These classes include the two interfaces Zombie, and Titan. The Boss interface has also been updated to include the 'special' method. This method can be implemented by certain enemies to use a special attack.
Began working on the Tower class. The EventHandler interface was also created and is intended to help read specific events such as button presses or clicks.

Updated the project structure once again. The 'world' package was removed and the 'scenes' and 'maps' packages were relocated. The Enemies, Towers, and Maps classes were all removed as well. The ArrayLists of active enemies and towers can now simply be found in the Enemy and Tower classes respectively. The MapBuilder interface was also removed because it wasn't entirely necessary.

Began implementing Tower attacks. Towers, specifically the Scout, can now be placed wherever the user clicks the screen. Currently, the implemented attack and placement methods are very primitive and will likely be updated continuously in the future.
Added JAVADOC and code comments to the remaining methods within the Tower class.
Added a variety of sound effects to the game. A few methods and constructors have also been removed from the Enemy and Tower classes as well as a few of the inheritors.

Implemented the targeting for the Tower class. Currently, the Tower can either target the first Enemy along a given Path or the last Enemy. In the future, there will be more targeting modes that the Tower can use. These modes will include the 'strongest' and 'weakest' targeting modes. In addition to this, a variety of other classes that will be implemented in the future have been added to the project. These classes include new Towers, the MapBuilder, and the CharacterBuilder class.

Fully implemented the Marksman and Gunner towers, each being equipped with their own methods of attack. The 'strongest' and 'weakest' targeting modes for towers have also been fully implemented. The AudioPlayer class has also been added, making it much easier to play both sound effects and music.
There was a missed compiler error in the previous commit. That is the only change that has been made.

Fixed a bug regarding the 'getTarget' method in the Tower class. Previously, the tower would attempt to target hidden and flying enemies even without having hidden and flying detection capabilities. This would ultimately cause the Tower to get stuck and unable to attack other enemies. The Stealthy zombie has also now been added. It is the first zombie to properly use the hidden Type.

Fixed a bug regarding the 'getTarget' method. Previously, it was possible for a ConcurrentModificationException to be thrown which would render the Tower unable to attack any Enemies. That bug has now been fixed.

Implemented the LootBox zombies into the game. LootBox zombies are unique in that when are eliminated, they will spawn a random zombie at their Position. Other iterations of the LootBox zombie include the LootBoxTitan which functions almost identically except that LootBoxTitans will spawn titans at their Position instead of zombies. The Zombie, Titan, and Boss annotations have been added as identifiers to clarify which enemies are zombies, titans, or bosses.

Fully implemented the GiantTitan and LootBoxTitan. The LootBoxTitan's 'onDeath' event will spawn another Titan at its location. Enemy implementations will slow down going forward and more work will we be done to finish the Tower class and also add new, more powerful Towers.
Forgot about another compiler error. The error has been fixed.

Re-implemented a variety of useful tools that had been previously removed. These tools include the Specific and Prohibited annotations as well as the newly implemented Property annotation. The Specific annotation allows an annotated method or constructor to specify which classes can access that constructor or method. The Prohibited annotation is similar to the Specific annotation however specified classes will be unable to access the annotated constructor or method. The Property annotation indicates that an annotated field is a property of a class.

Fully re-implemented the tools from the previous commit. These tools include the Specific and Prohibited annotations as well as the LogManager class. The Property annotation has also been implemented and indicates that an annotated field is an inherent property of a class.

Implemented Tower and Enemy ranges into the game. Towers can no longer continue to attack enemies even when they are halfway across the Player's screen. Enemy ranges, while implemented, do not currently do anything as Enemy attacks have not yet been implemented. New towers and enemy attacks will be implemented in the near future.

Once again removed a variety of tools that just wound up doing more harm than good. These tools include the Specific and Prohibited annotations as well as their verification classes, SpecificAnnotation and ProhibitedAnnotation. The verification was causing noticeable levels of lag and has thus been removed.
Fixed a missed compiler error in the module-info file.

Implemented a basic version of the Energizer. The Energizer, unlike most other Towers, has hidden detection capabilities starting at level 0. The Energizer is also capable of extreme amounts of damage and can easily deal with enemies like the NormalTitan. The current implementation of the Energizer is not final and is subject to change. The GameScene class has also been changed as the Waves that spawn now more accurately reflect what a typical round of the finished game may look like.

Added the Pyromancer to the game. The Pyromancer is unique in that it has no base damage but can burn Enemies. When an Enemy is burned, it will move slower and take a set amount of damage every second. In the future, when Tower upgrades are implemented, the time an Enemy may remain burned will increase along with the burn damage.

Implemented the most basic version of the final game. Currently, the player is able to do everything that will be available in the final game except tower upgrades. More enemies and towers will be added in the next commit.

Implemented the Summoner and Armored zombies into the game. The Summoner zombies have the ability to spawn 5 random Enemies every 15 seconds. The Armored zombies are the first Enemies to use a 'shield'. Shields can only be damaged if enough damage is actually dealt to the Enemy. For example, if an Enemy has 20 base HP and 15 shield, a Tower can only begin to wear down the Shield if the Tower does a minimum of 5 damage. More Towers will be added in the next commit.
Made an update to the LootBox zombie. The LootBox zombie will no longer grant money when damaged. The Summoner has also been renamed to the Sorcerer.

Reworked the Energizer. The Energizer will now attack an Enemy until that Enemy has been eliminated. The Sorcerer has also been reworked. Instead of using a completely separate thread to spawn Enemies, the Sorcerer now uses the Enemy attack thread. The Bolt Enemy has also been implemented.
Fixed the Wave structure in the GameScene class. Also added Waves 25 and 26 to Easy mode.

Added a Wave counter to the GameScene class. Also fixed an issue with the Marksman, Gunner, and Pyromancer Towers. These Towers had not previously set their starting health to 0. This would cause them to get instantly eliminated by Soldier Enemies.
Fixed an issue with the Sorcerer where it would spawn Enemies even after it was eliminated.
Re-fixed the issue regarding the Sorcerer. The previous commit did not actually address the issue.

Implemented the Gunship and Shotgunner Towers into the game. The Shotgunner functions almost identically to every other Tower other than it has a rather slow long cool down but does decent damage. The Gunship is unique as it completes circular paths for an indefinite amount of time and attacks any Enemies that wind up underneath it. The OilRig class has also been added to the game. The OilRig is meant to be the legendary version of the Farm. The OilRig will generate money at a constant rate instead of at the start of every wave.
Game is currently bugged. This commit is just to test whether the bug is a hardware issue.

Fixed the previously mentioned bug. The bug had caused random Enemies to move at significantly slower speeds when spawned than they are supposed to. In addition to fixing that bug, the GameScene class has also been set up to now fit any computer screen. Lastly, in addition to fixing the previously mentioned animation bug, all other animation bugs have been fixed. These bugs include: Enemies getting stuck at spawn, Enemies stopping at various Positions along their set Path, and Enemies moving at slightly different speeds.
